ETYMOLOGY: From Old English hǣth, from Proto-Germanic *haithī, related to Dutch heide and German Heide.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A tract of open uncultivated land, especially in Britain, typically covered with heather, gorse, and coarse grasses.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一片开阔的未开垦土地，尤指英国，通常长满石南花、金雀花和粗草。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The wild ponies roamed freely across the vast heath.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 野马在广阔的荒原上自由奔跑。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Any of various low-growing evergreen shrubs, especially of the genera Erica or Calluna, that typically grow on open uncultivated land.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 泛指杜鹃花科的矮小常绿灌木，尤指石南属（*Erica*）或帚石南属（*Calluna*），通常生长在开阔的未开垦土地上。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Bees gathered nectar from the tiny purple blooms of the heath.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 蜜蜂从石南花微小的紫色花朵中采集花蜜。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (Archaic) A heathen or pagan; a person who does not belong to a widely held religion.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （古语）异教徒，不信仰主流宗教的人。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The ancient texts spoke of converting the heath to the true faith.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 古老的文本讲述了将异教徒们皈依真理的故事。

REGISTER: General for meanings 1 and 2; archaic for meaning 3.
